  • Changelog

    Data - Generates ratio of tree domain variables.

    datSumTreeDomRatio.Rd

    Generates ratio of tree domain summaries from FIESTA::datSumTreedom().

    datSumTreeDomRatio(
  ndat,
  ddat,
  uniqueid = "PLT_CN",
  nprefix = NULL,
  dprefix = NULL,
  rprefix = "r",
  datround = NULL,
  savedata = FALSE,
  savedata_opts = NULL,
  gui = FALSE
)

    Arguments

    ndat

    Dataframe, comma-delimited file (*.csv), or shapefile (*.shp). Table from FIESTA::datSumTreeDomRatio() with numerator tree domain variables.

    ddat

    Dataframe, comma-delimited file (*.csv), or shapefile (*.shp). Table from FIESTA::datSumTreeDomRatio() with numerator tree domain variables.

    uniqueid

    String. The unique identifier of both tables (default = "PLT_CN").

    nprefix

    String. The prefix variable identifier of numerator domain variables in ndat.

    dprefix

    String. The prefix variable identifier of denominator domain variables in ddat.

    rprefix

    String. The prefix variable identifier of new ratio variables (default="r").

    datround

    Integer. Number of digits to round ratio values to.

    savedata

    Logical. If TRUE, saves data to outfolder.

    savedata_opts

    List. See help(savedata_options()) for a list of options. Only used when savedata = TRUE. If out_layer = NULL, default = 'tsumrat'.

    gui

    Logical. If gui, user is prompted for parameters.

    Value

    rdat

    Data frame. Table with ratio values (ndat / ddat).

    rvars

    String vector. Variable names in rdat.

    If savedata=TRUE, the data table will be saved to the outfolder:

    Author

    Tracey S. Frescino

    Examples

    # Ratio of live and dead basal area
# Live basal area
live <- datSumTreeDom(tree = FIESTA::WYtree, 
                      tuniqueid = "PLT_CN", 
                      tsumvar = "BA", 
                      tfilter = "STATUSCD==1")
#> Warning: COND_STATUS_CD not in table, assuming forested plots with no ACI plots
#> filter removed 5537 records: STATUSCD==1
                      
# Dead basal area                       
dead <- datSumTreeDom(tree = FIESTA::WYtree, 
                      tuniqueid = "PLT_CN", 
                      tsumvar = "BA", 
                      tfilter = "STATUSCD == 2 & STANDING_DEAD_CD == 1")
#> Warning: COND_STATUS_CD not in table, assuming forested plots with no ACI plots
#> filter removed 13474 records: STATUSCD == 2 & STANDING_DEAD_CD == 1

# Ratio of dead and live basal area                        
ratio <- FIESTA:::datSumTreeDomRatio(ndat = dead$tdomdat,
                                     ddat = live$tdomdat)    

str(ratio, max.level = 1)
#> List of 2
#>  $ rdat :'data.frame':	409 obs. of  20 variables:
#>  $ rvars: chr [1:19] "r19" "r65" "r66" "r93" ...

head(ratio$rdat)
